register.description: This register makes possible to control some settings of CSIRXFE cells used in the design

bitfield.description: Read returns reset value.
Active Low asynchronous reset signal for CSIb_interface
Power Down control for CSIb_interface0: CSIb differential transceiver is powered down1: CSIb differential transceiver is active
Read returns reset value.
CSI receiver transmission format selection for CSIb_interface0: Data/clock transmission format.1: Data/Strobe transmission format
Read returns reset value.
Enable resistor for CSIb_interface0: CSIb internal resistor is disconnected (use external termination resistor)1: CSIb internal resistor is enabled
Strobe/Clock inversion control for CSIb_interface0: CSIb internal data latched on rising edge of clock1: CSIb internal data latched on falling edge of clock
Read returns reset value.

register.description: Configure drive strength of I/O cells

bitfield.description: Read returns reset value

Drive strength for impedance and current output:0x0: Drive strength set to 20 Ω, 8 mA 0x2: Drive strength set to 25 Ω, 6 mA 0x1: Drive strength set to 40 Ω, 4 mA 0x3: Drive strength set to 65 Ω, 2 mA

register.description: This register controls the settings for PBIAS LITE MMC/SD/SDIO1 pins

bitfield.description: Reserved for future use
Status indicating whether PBIAS1 is supplied by 1.8 V or 3.0 V SIM_VDDS
Reserved for future use

Status indicating if the software programmed VMODE level matches the SUPPLY_HI output signal0b0 => VMODE Level same or VMODE level not considered . 0b1 => Indicates VMODE_LEVEL not same as SUPPLY_HI_OUT .
Speed control for PBIAS1 associated I/O cell0b0 => 26 MHz I/O max speed . 0b1 => 52 MHz I/O max speed .
Input signal referenced to VDD2. Software must keep this signal low when SIM_VDDS is ramping up.0b0 => SIM_VDDS ramping up . 0b1 => SIM_VDDS stable .
SIM_VDDS voltage level information control from software0b0 => SIM_VDDS = 1.8 V . 0b1 => SIM_VDDS = 3.0 V .
Status indicating if PBIAS0 is supplied by 1.8 V or 3.0 V MMC1_VDDS0b0 => PBIAS0 is supplied by MMC1_VDDS = 1.8 V . 0b1 => PBIAS0 is supplied by MMC1_VDDS = 3.0 V .
Read returns reset value.

Status indicating if the software programmed VMODE level matches the SUPPLY_HI output signal0b0 => VMODE Level same or VMODE level not considered . 0b1 => Indicates VMODE_LEVEL not same as SUPPLY_HI_OUT .
Speed control for MMC I/O0b0 => 26 MHz I/O max speed . 0b1 => 52 MHz I/O max speed .
Input signal referenced to VDD2. Software must keep this signal low when MMC1_VDDS is ramping up.0b0 => MMC1_VDDS ramping up . 0b1 => MMC1_VDDS stable .
MMC1_VDDS voltage level information control from software0b0 => MMC1_VDDS = 1.8 V . 0b1 => MMC1_VDDS = 3.0 V .

register.description: temperature sensor register

bitfield.description: Read returns reset value.
VDD level digital inputs. When high the ADC is in continuous conversion mode0 : ADC Single Conversion Mode;1 : ADC Continuous Conversion Mode
ADC Start of Conversion. A transition to high starts a new ADC conversion cycle
ADC End of Conversion. Active low, when CTRL_ TEMP[6:0] is valid
Temperature data from the ADC. Valid if EOCZ is low
